title: Sardine Pasta
instructions: Bring salted water to a boil for pasta and cook for 8 minutes.
While pasta cooks, prepare ingredients: chop tomatoes, parsley, garlic, and capers.
Heat olive oil from the sardines in a pan.
Add salt, garlic, capers, and more olive oil.
Add a bit of pasta water to create a sauce.
Add most of the sardines, breaking them up but leaving some chunks. Reserve one fillet for topping.
Add a bit of lemon juice.
Cook the sauce for a few minutes until pasta is done.
Add drained pasta directly to the sauce, saving the pasta water.
Flip the pasta in the sauce a few times to coat.
Add some parsley and a touch more pasta water if needed.
Plate the pasta, garnish with additional parsley and the reserved sardine fillet.
notes: This is a quick 10-minute meal that's economical and a great way to use tinned sardines. The recipe uses Cornish tinned sardines.
